input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose deletion you are canceling. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

output.KeyId: The ARN of the CMK whose deletion you canceled.

CancelKeyDeletion.description: The following example cancels deletion of the specified CMK.
CancelKeyDeletion.title: To cancel deletion of a customer master key (CMK)

input.AliasName: The alias to create. Aliases must begin with 'alias/'. Do not use aliases that begin with 'alias/aws' because they are reserved for use by AWS.
input.TargetKeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose alias you are creating. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

CreateAlias.description: The following example creates an alias for the specified customer master key (CMK).
CreateAlias.title: To create an alias

input.KeyId: arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:444455556666:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab

input.GranteePrincipal: The identity that is given permission to perform the operations specified in the grant.
input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK to which the grant applies. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.
input.Operations: A list of operations that the grant allows.

output.GrantId: The unique identifier of the grant.

CreateGrant.description: The following example creates a grant that allows the specified IAM role to encrypt data with the specified customer master key (CMK).
CreateGrant.title: To create a grant

input.Tags: One or more tags. Each tag consists of a tag key and a tag value.

output.KeyMetadata: An object that contains information about the CMK created by this operation.

CreateKey.description: The following example creates a CMK.
CreateKey.title: To create a customer master key (CMK)

output.KeyId: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK that was used to decrypt the data.

Decrypt.description: The following example decrypts data that was encrypted with a customer master key (CMK) in AWS KMS.
Decrypt.title: To decrypt data

DeleteAlias.description: The following example deletes the specified alias.
DeleteAlias.title: To delete an alias

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose imported key material you are deleting. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

DeleteImportedKeyMaterial.description: The following example deletes the imported key material from the specified customer master key (CMK).
DeleteImportedKeyMaterial.title: To delete imported key material

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK that you want information about. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

output.KeyMetadata: An object that contains information about the specified CMK.

DescribeKey.description: The following example returns information (metadata) about the specified CMK.
DescribeKey.title: To obtain information about a customer master key (CMK)

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK to disable. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

DisableKey.description: The following example disables the specified CMK.
DisableKey.title: To disable a customer master key (CMK)

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose key material will no longer be rotated. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

DisableKeyRotation.description: The following example disables automatic annual rotation of the key material for the specified CMK.
DisableKeyRotation.title: To disable automatic rotation of key material

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK to enable. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

EnableKey.description: The following example enables the specified CMK.
EnableKey.title: To enable a customer master key (CMK)

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose key material will be rotated annually. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

EnableKeyRotation.description: The following example enables automatic annual rotation of the key material for the specified CMK.
EnableKeyRotation.title: To enable automatic rotation of key material

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK to use for encryption. You can use the key ID or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK, or the name or ARN of an alias that refers to the CMK.

output.KeyId: The ARN of the CMK that was used to encrypt the data.

Encrypt.description: The following example encrypts data with the specified customer master key (CMK).
Encrypt.title: To encrypt data

input.KeyId: alias/ExampleAlias
The identifier of the CMK to use to encrypt the data key. You can use the key ID or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK, or the name or ARN of an alias that refers to the CMK.
input.KeySpec: Specifies the type of data key to return.

output.KeyId: The ARN of the CMK that was used to encrypt the data key.

GenerateDataKey.description: The following example generates a 256-bit symmetric data encryption key (data key) in two formats. One is the unencrypted (plainext) data key, and the other is the data key encrypted with the specified customer master key (CMK).
GenerateDataKey.title: To generate a data key

input.KeyId: alias/ExampleAlias
The identifier of the CMK to use to encrypt the data key. You can use the key ID or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK, or the name or ARN of an alias that refers to the CMK.
input.KeySpec: Specifies the type of data key to return.

output.KeyId: The ARN of the CMK that was used to encrypt the data key.

GenerateDataKeyWithoutPlaintext.description: The following example generates an encrypted copy of a 256-bit symmetric data encryption key (data key). The data key is encrypted with the specified customer master key (CMK).
GenerateDataKeyWithoutPlaintext.title: To generate an encrypted data key

input.NumberOfBytes: The length of the random data, specified in number of bytes.

GenerateRandom.description: The following example uses AWS KMS to generate 32 bytes of random data.
GenerateRandom.title: To generate random data

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose key policy you want to retrieve. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.
input.PolicyName: The name of the key policy to retrieve.

GetKeyPolicy.description: The following example retrieves the key policy for the specified customer master key (CMK).
GetKeyPolicy.title: To retrieve a key policy

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose key material rotation status you want to retrieve. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

output.KeyRotationEnabled: A boolean that indicates the key material rotation status. Returns true when automatic annual rotation of the key material is enabled, or false when it is not.

GetKeyRotationStatus.description: The following example retrieves the status of automatic annual rotation of the key material for the specified CMK.
GetKeyRotationStatus.title: To retrieve the rotation status for a customer master key (CMK)

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK for which to retrieve the public key and import token. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.
input.WrappingAlgorithm: The algorithm that you will use to encrypt the key material before importing it.
input.WrappingKeySpec: The type of wrapping key (public key) to return in the response.

output.ImportToken: The import token to send with a subsequent ImportKeyMaterial request.
output.KeyId: The ARN of the CMK for which you are retrieving the public key and import token. This is the same CMK specified in the request.
output.ParametersValidTo: The time at which the import token and public key are no longer valid.
output.PublicKey: The public key to use to encrypt the key material before importing it.

GetParametersForImport.description: The following example retrieves the public key and import token for the specified CMK.
GetParametersForImport.title: To retrieve the public key and import token for a customer master key (CMK)

input.EncryptedKeyMaterial: The encrypted key material to import.
input.ExpirationModel: A value that specifies whether the key material expires.
input.ImportToken: The import token that you received in the response to a previous GetParametersForImport request.
input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK to import the key material into. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

ImportKeyMaterial.description: The following example imports key material into the specified CMK.
ImportKeyMaterial.title: To import key material into a customer master key (CMK)

output.Aliases: A list of aliases, including the key ID of the customer master key (CMK) that each alias refers to.
output.Truncated: A boolean that indicates whether there are more items in the list. Returns true when there are more items, or false when there are not.

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose grants you want to list. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

output.Truncated: A boolean that indicates whether there are more items in the list. Returns true when there are more items, or false when there are not.

output.Truncated: A boolean that indicates whether there are more items in the list. Returns true when there are more items, or false when there are not.

ListKeyPolicies.title: To list key policies for a customer master key (CMK)

output.Keys: A list of CMKs, including the key ID and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of each one.
output.Truncated: A boolean that indicates whether there are more items in the list. Returns true when there are more items, or false when there are not.

input.KeyId: The identifier of the CMK whose tags you are listing. You can use the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK.

output.Grants: A list of grants that the specified principal can retire.
output.Truncated: A boolean that indicates whether there are more items in the list. Returns true when there are more items, or false when there are not.

input.PolicyName: The name of the key policy.
